pli-tv-pvr1.10:0.4.eng: The number of offenses within each offense

pli-tv-pvr1.10:0.5.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of having sexual intercourse?

pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā catasso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.2.eng: One commits four kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.3.pli: akkhāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.3.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.4.pli: yebhuyyena khāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.4.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.5.pli: vaṭṭakate mukhe acchupantaṃ aṅgajātaṃ paveseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.5.eng: when one inserts one’s penis into a wide open mouth without touching it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.6.eng: when one uses a dildo, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.7.pli: methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā imā catasso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of stealing?

pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.3.pli: Pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.3.eng: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth five māsaka coins or more, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.4.pli: atirekamāsakaṃ vā ūnapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.4.eng: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth more than one māsaka coin but less than five, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.5.pli: māsakaṃ vā ūnamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.5.eng: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth one māsaka coin or less, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.6.pli: adinnaṃ ādiyanapaccayā imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.1.pli: Sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of intentionally killing a human being?

pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.2.pli: Sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.3.pli: Manussaṃ odissa opātaṃ khaṇati “papatitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.3.eng: when one digs a pit for a human being, thinking, “Falling into it, they will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.4.pli: papatite dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.4.eng: when they experience pain after falling in, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.5.eng: when they die, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.6.pli: sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropanapaccayā imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.1.pli: Asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of claiming a non-existent superhuman quality?

pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.2.pli: Asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.3.pli: pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.3.eng: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.4.pli: “yo te vihāre vasati so bhikkhu arahā”ti bhaṇati, paṭivijānantassa āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.4.eng: when one says, “The monk who stays in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.5.eng: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.6.pli: asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapanapaccayā imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:5.1.eng: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.0.eng: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension, etc.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of emitting semen by means of effort?

pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.3.eng: when one intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.4.pli: ceteti upakkamati na muccati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.4.eng: when one intends and makes an effort, but semen is not emitted, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.5.eng: for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.6.pli: upakkamitvā asucimocanapaccayā imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of making physical contact with a woman?

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.2.eng: One commits five kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.3.pli: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ gahaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.3.eng: when a lustful nun consents to a lustful man taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.4.pli: bhikkhu kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.4.eng: when a monk makes physical contact, body with body, he commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.5.eng: when, with one’s own body, one makes physical contact with something connected to their body, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.6.eng: when, with something connected to one’s own body, one makes physical contact with something connected to their body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.7.eng: for tickling, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.8.pli: kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanapaccayā imā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.1.pli: Mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.1.eng: As a result of speaking indecently to a woman, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.2.pli: vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.2.eng: when, referring to the anus or the vagina, one praises or disparages, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.3.pli: vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ṭhapetvā adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.3.eng: when, referring to any part below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, one praises or disparages, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.4.pli: kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.4.eng: when, referring to anything connected to the body, one praises or disparages, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.1.pli: Attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.1.eng: As a result of encouraging the satisfaction of one’s own desires, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.2.pli: mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.2.eng: when one encourages a woman to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.3.pli: paṇḍakassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.3.eng: when one encourages a paṇḍaka to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.4.pli: tiracchānagatassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.4.eng: when one encourages an animal to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.1.eng: As a result of acting as a matchmaker, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.2.eng: when one accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.3.pli: paṭiggaṇhāti vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.3.eng: when one accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.4.pli: paṭiggaṇhāti na vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.4.eng: when one accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.1.pli: Saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kārāpanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.1.eng: As a result of having a hut built by means of begging, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.2.eng: when one is having it built, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.3.eng: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.4.eng: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.1.pli: Mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kārāpanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.1.eng: As a result of having a large dwelling built, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.2.eng: when one is having it built, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.3.eng: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.4.eng: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.1.eng: As a result of groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.2.pli: anokāsaṃ kārāpetvā cāvanādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.2.eng: when, without having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.3.pli: okāsaṃ kārāpetvā akkosādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti omasavādassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.3.eng: when, having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.1.eng: As a result of charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.2.pli: anokāsaṃ kārāpetvā cāvanādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.2.eng: when, without having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.3.pli: okāsaṃ kārāpetvā akkosādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti omasavādassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.3.eng: when, having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:15.1.pli: Saṅghabhedako bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:15.1.eng: As a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time, a monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:15.2.eng: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:15.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:15.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:16.1.pli: Bhedakānuvattakā bhikkhū yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjanti—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:16.1.eng: As a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time, monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism commit three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:16.2.eng: after the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:16.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:16.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:17.1.pli: Dubbaco bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:17.1.eng: As a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time, a monk who is difficult to correct commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:17.2.eng: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:17.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:17.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.1.pli: Kuladūsako bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati—
pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.1.eng: As a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time, a monk who is a corrupter of families commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.2.eng: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension. …

pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.1.eng: As a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.2.eng: One commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.4.pli: anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā imaṃ ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.10:20.1.eng: The number of offenses within each offense, the second, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.11:0.4.eng: The classes of failure for each offense

pli-tv-pvr1.11:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.11:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of having sexual intercourse, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.11:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr1.11:1.2.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.11:1.3.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr1.11:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajati?
pli-tv-pvr1.11:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense that is a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, to how many of the four kinds of failure does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.11:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajati—
pli-tv-pvr1.11:2.2.eng: It belongs to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.11:3.1.eng: The classes of failure for each offense, the third, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.12:0.4.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense

pli-tv-pvr1.12:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr1.12:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of having sexual intercourse, in how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr1.12:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ catūhi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr1.12:1.3.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.12:1.3.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr1.12:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr1.12:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense that is a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, in how many of the seven classes of offenses is it found?

pli-tv-pvr1.12:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ ekena āpattikkhandhena saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr1.12:2.3.eng: in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.12:3.1.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense, the fourth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.13:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.13:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of having sexual intercourse, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.13:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ ekena samuṭṭhānena samuṭṭhanti—

pli-tv-pvr1.13:1.3.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.13:1.3.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.13:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti?
pli-tv-pvr1.13:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense that is a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.13:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ ekena samuṭṭhānena samuṭṭhāti—

pli-tv-pvr1.13:2.3.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.13:2.3.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.13:3.1.eng: The originations of each offense, the fifth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.14:0.4.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs

pli-tv-pvr1.14:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr1.14:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of having sexual intercourse, to which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.14:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ āpattādhikaraṇaṃ …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.14:1.2.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense. …

pli-tv-pvr1.14:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr1.14:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense that is a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, to which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.14:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.14:2.2.eng: It belongs to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.14:3.1.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs, the sixth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.15:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.15:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of having sexual intercourse, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.15:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammanti—

pli-tv-pvr1.15:1.3.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted;

pli-tv-pvr1.15:1.4.eng: or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr1.15:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammati?
pli-tv-pvr1.15:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offense that is a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.15:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā āpatti sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammati—

pli-tv-pvr1.15:2.3.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena cāti.
pli-tv-pvr1.15:2.3.eng: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr1.15:3.1.eng: How each offense is settled, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:0.4.eng: Summary of the previous six sections

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.1.eng: As a result of having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā catasso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.2.eng: One commits four kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.3.pli: Akkhāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.3.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.4.pli: yebhuyyena khāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.4.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.5.pli: vaṭṭakate mukhe acchupantaṃ aṅgajātaṃ paveseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.5.eng: when one inserts one’s penis into a wide open mouth without touching it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.6.eng: when one uses a dildo, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.7.pli: methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā imā catasso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.8.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.8.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.9.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.10.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.11.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.12.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.13.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.13.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.14.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.15.eng: They are found in four classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.16.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.16.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.18.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.18.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.19.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.20.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.21.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca, paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.21.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.1.eng: As a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.2.eng: One commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.4.pli: anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā imaṃ ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.5.pli: Sā āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajati?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.5.eng: When it comes to this offense, to how many of the four kinds of failure does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.6.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses is it found?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.7.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.8.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.9.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.10.pli: Sā āpatti catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajati—
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.10.eng: It belongs to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.12.eng: It is found in one class of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.13.eng: in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.15.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.15.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.16.eng: It belongs to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.17.eng: It is settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.18.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena cāti.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.18.eng: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.1.eng: The summary of the previous six sections, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.2.eng: The eight sections on “as a result of” are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.3.eng: The sixteen great sections in The Great Analysis are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.16:4.1.eng: The great section of the Monks’ Analysis is finished.
